title: Roasted Beets With Orange And Ginger
summary: Roasted Beets With Orange And Ginger might be just the side dish you are searching for. For $1.38 per serving, this recipe covers 11% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains approximately 4g of protein, 15g of fat, and a total of 225 calories. This recipe serves 4. 9 people were glad they tried this recipe. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 diet. If you have orange, ginger, olive oil, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 1 hour and 6 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 79%. This score is solid. Try Orange Ginger Beets With Carrots, Brine-pickled Beets with Ginger and Orange, and Roasted Honey Ginger Beets and Winter Squash for similar recipes.
instructions: Heat oven to 425 degrees. Lay a large piece of aluminum foil on a baking sheet and place beets in the center. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Wrap foil loosely around beets and roast in oven until beets are tender when pierced with a fork, about 1 hour. Let stand until cool enough to handle.

steps.step: Lay a large piece of aluminum foil on a baking sheet and place beets in the center.
Drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Wrap foil loosely around beets and roast in oven until beets are tender when pierced with a fork, about 1 hour.
Let stand until cool enough to handle.
